title: Still a Fan, and it Only Gets Better
text: Since finding AirBnB a few years ago, I can’t imagine staying at any location other than those listed in such a game-changing experience. In the past I’ve used ”glamping” sites and ”Flipkey,” and I’ve had amazing experiences in those stays, but AirBnB’s listings have afforded me the luxury of staying at unique homes I’d never have the opportunity to stay at otherwise. I’m a writer and artist, and the landscape and tranquility of these spaces, inspired some of my best work. Whether I stay a short walking distance from my campus, or needing a spur of the moment mindfulness staycation,I’m an unwavering fan. I hope they continue to improve- find a medium which is beneficial to not only those who share their space or host, but to guests looking for the 5-star service we all enjoy.

title: Poor Communication, Ridiculous Fees
text:
In February we booked a rental for September for a guy’s reunion. AirBnB charged a 15% fee. In the middle of the pandemic, as a group of physicians, we decided the risk was too great so we decided to cancel. Rather than wait till close to the reservation time I chose to see if we could cancel early so it could be rebooked by someone not concerned with the risk. The host was excellent and refunded our money. Trying to contact AirBnB about how to do that and if they’d be willing to do likewise with their high fee was a real exercise in patience. It took WEEKS to get even an initial response by email. Despite an appeal, they did not refund the high fee. The place was re-booked within a few weeks so the only person to lose in this arrangement was me - even though I tried to do the best thing for everyone. 

AirBnB has poor customer service, particularly in light of their ridiculously high fees for little value. They’re simply interested in raking in money using the resources of their hosts.

title: I would give negative stars if I could
text: I only used Airbnb once and it was the worst travel experience I’ve ever had. On top of that, you can’t get customer service to help you or talk to you at all!! I stayed at a house grossly misrepresented, the back door  didn’t have a lock, incredibly old and in awful condition, two rooms were not pictured in the listing and were hideous with furniture I was afraid to sit on and the electricity went out three times. I didn’t even spend the night, asked for a refund and even had my review taken down! They apparently cater to the renter and not the rentee. I sent over 15 messages because they don’t have customer service reps who will help via phone, they tell you to go online and you never get a response and I called three times with no resolution. I felt unsafe and wasted $500. I just deleted my account and will never use this service again. I hope you don’t have a terrible situation like bed bugs, safety, or inadequate housing because you will never get help, moved elsewhere or compensated.

title: I’m Done with Airbnb
text: I used to love Airbnb until I had problems trying to cancel one of my reservation. I got an email for Airbnb saying my trip was canceled but then they only gave me half of the refund and kept my reservation for a day (when the email and cancelation policy said I would be receiving my full refund and both days were canceled.) I messaged their support team through Airbnb and got NO WHERE. I even sent them pictures of the email I got from them, saying it was canceled. I then tried calling Airbnb and they said they couldn’t do anything because it was being processed through there “trip team.” They couldn’t even give me an answer on when they were going to contact me since they couldn’t transfer me over to them through the phone. Now, since it’s past the date to get the refund, they are saying that the host is denying my request to cancel the trip. I’M NEVER USING AIRBNB AGAIN. Just wait until you have a problem with one of your reservations and you’ll see how horrible those costumer service is!!

title: Needs Improvement
text:
Overall the Airbnb app proved to be very useful and helpful, however, it does need some changes and improvements. 

Date Clarity- For example, based off my first experience with using Airbnb yesterday and today, it is really confusing if your not familiar with the app: (for me at least)  
So I would really suggest adding Labels to the dates. For example say you book a place from November 21- November 22, that’s what I did. And I was under the impression that I payed for 2 nights, and that I would check out on November 23rd. Well apparently not. It’s for one night, and you check out the next day. So when I found out I only paid for one night, it was quite a let down. My siblings were so angry, as they thought they we paid for 2 nights. So I’d suggest putting green for the dates you want, and red for checkout dates. 

Dark/ light mode for sensitive eyes 
Accessibility  features for VI. As a visually impaired person, it would truly be great to have filters. And bigger text. Maybe even text to audio. Because on Samsung the accessibility feature aren’t the greatest 
And that’s all of the changes and improvements I have for now. I hope all of you fellow app developers take some of these into consideration, and I hope I get to see some of these added sometime in the future.

title: Poor customer service
text: I booked airbnb for two trips. There were no problems until I had to verify my ID. When I did this, it kept saying an error so I re did it once. Then it finally verified my ID. Once I did this it made me take an additional picture of myself. Soon after, all my reservations were cancelled. I have been attempting to get this problem resolved. It’s been four days. They lied to me and said there wasn’t a department that used the phone so they said an emails would be sent. I called every single day. One time they said they can’t transfer me because the call volume is too high. Which one is it? I also said it was weird that they don’t require all iDs verified and they did not do this to my boyfriend. When I suggested unfair treatment, they tried to blame the hosts for choosing whether or not my ID is verified. They take no responsibility and I probably will never get my problems resolved. They cancelled my one reservation a day before it happened. I will never use Airbnb.

title: NEVER USE
text: I am disgusted. I have used Airbnb forever and here recently I found out I will not use them anymore. I had a trip scheduled that had to be cancelled due to severe weather of an incoming hurricane. I contacted them BEFORE the reservation ever started because the host refused to give a full refund given the circumstances. With Airbnb you are supposed to be protected against things like that. They have finally gotten back to me,  three days into the reservation that wasn’t cancelled on my end because THEY were in the middle of cancelling and resolving it and I wanted to be able to get my money back. I am getting roughly 143$ when I paid about 400$.  They said the location I was going would not be affected by the hurricane even though it was for the entire first half of my trip AND I sent proof of 30mph winds and severe thunderstorms. Not only was this weather going to be severe there but on my drive there as I lived in the area it went up through. NEVER again. They obviously don’t care about their customers. I’d rather pay more to go elsewhere

title: Horrible customer service!
text:
I tried to book a house which said it was available for an upcoming weekend. I was charged the full price for the house even though I was then told the owner first needs to approve the weekend (why am I being charged if I don’t even have the reservation?). Houses should not be listed as available if people cannot book them.

In order to get my refund I had to work with the Airbnb customer service which is one of the worst experiences I’ve had. They tell you they will get right back to you but never respond to your questions. Then if they do respond they do it in the middle of the night and then respond multiple times asking if they resolved your issue. News flash people are not up at 4AM checking their emails. It also takes 15 business days for a refund to process which is insane! I honestly feel like this is some sort of scam. No wonder the FBI is investigating them now. I’m also reporting them to the better business bureau. I’d strongly recommend another service!

title: Great choices
text: I love the well described property listings. The many pictures posted on every home is a great way to help you decide which home is right for you. The things that I don’t like about the app is that you don’t get the exact city you want on the search. It will include homes in various cities all around. If there are a lot of homes to choose from this makes it difficult. They don’t post the name of the city on the first picture of the home where the title is. You have to click on that home and then you can see the city name. It wastes a lot of time while choosing a place. Also I don’t like that the price can display on the front page so inaccurately. It may say $100 per night but once you click on details there can be up to $150 or more in various added charges like cleaning and service fees. This also wastes a lot of time.

title: Once an avid user, never again!!!
text: I used to love AirBnB. I mean seriously love it. I never went to hotels or motels or condos when traveling, I only used AirBnB. Well now things have changed! One bad apple ruins it for the rest. I had a horrible host who misled her guests to think they were staying in style but upon arrival it’s nothing more than a shack attached to the owners house. Staying there was miserable but I had no choice. There was mold in the soap containers, bugs crawling from a hole in the shower, ac problems, water problems, and BED BUGS. Now I have been in contact with Airbnb for the last week trying to get a refund. Ive been woefully ignored and been told my issues are a “MINOR INCONVENIENCE”?! Never have I heard that mold and bed bugs are a minor thing. Airbnb lost my respect when they decided to not treat their guests with absolute lack of care and respect. Worst experience EVER. I’ll only ever stay in hotels again. At least they’d give me a refund and comp a room for me if I had the same issues. F-, ZERO stars if I could!!!

title: Not reliable for your trip
text: I have used Airbnb for a while with no problems until now as I booked two places in different cities for my road-trip vacation. I booked weeks ago and my trip was getting close and suddenly, out of the blue, I got multiple emails informing me of the cancellation and partial refund for both of my trips. I tried to login in the app and it said my account has been deactivated. Got in touch with support and they can’t do anything…both bookings kept part of the deposit and now I have to book last minute hotels which is going to cost me a kidney. This company is not reliable, they deactivate your account for no reason, this has happened to many of my friends and I haven’t been reported and they have done all the security checks for my account. I had gotten positive replies to my reviews to the places I have stayed and there is no reason for them to just drop their bookings last minute like this. Great idea but not a reliable service.

title: Disgusted with Airbnb customer service
text: The custom service department is a complete joke! We booked a house that was disgusting with only working electrical outlets in the entire house. The working electrical plugs sparked and shocked you if you unplugged/plugged things. We contacted Airbnb with the safety concerns and the concerns of our extremely rude host and they proceeded to wait over 9 hours to even acknowledge this issue. They supposedly have a guarantee if the house is not clean or safe you can get a refund, this is a lie. I again contacted them for the third day in a row stating they should not have houses not meeting standard rental property codes and regulations on their app,  that the safety and well being of customers should be a priority and that they shouldn’t advertise having a refund/money back guarantee if the listing material is inaccurate and their response was “I understand. I am sorry to hear about your experience. Thank you for letting us know”. Beware of this app, it definitely scammed us out of a lot of money!

title: Trusting and trustworthy
text: This is my 4th year as an Airbnb hostess. I’ve met THE nicest people and had some great conversations with people from all over the world. I appreciate the review and verification system Airbnb has in place because it always helps me in evaluating who to let into my home. Plus the rating system also lets guests know that I’m trustworthy too. Great reciprocal system. A bunch of us had to stand up to our township when some other Airbnb hosts didn’t monitor their guests and almost ruined the opportunity for all of us. We eventually got the government to create a policy that was Airbnb friendly. You may have to do the same. It’s worth it. Meeting great folks and earning income that helps me stay in my home are both important to me. I love Airbnb and am so appreciative of the opportunity. Thanks Airbnb!!

title: Do Not Book through airbnb
text: I’ve used Airbnb multiple times in the past and never had an issue even though I know lots of people who have. Well, it finally happened. We booked a last minute Airbnb (like we arrived within a few hours of booking), walked in, and were immediately unhappy. The place called itself “retro,” when in reality it was just old and dilapidated. The sheets look like they hadn’t been washed, the towels were balled up and thrown in the cabinet, there was a single portable heater for the entire place (it was 30-40 degrees), the molding around the shower was coming off, and there was this awful musty odor and possible mold since my boyfriend started having a reaction. We left, contacted the owner and said we couldn’t stay. He told us to go through Airbnb, who in return just asks the owner for a refund and he said no. After multiple attempts to resolve our issue Airbnb would no longer work with us to resolve. I will forever more be booking only in hotels and verified VROB.

title: Better off with a hotel
text: Do not book an airbnb its not worth it and there are other booking sites with much better customer service. After a key to our place broke our airbnb host was unresponsive and at midnight for 2-3 hours we were trying to get in contact with airbnb kept getting the run around and had to boon our own emergency hotel room that we thankfully found in the dead of night at the beach in the summer time. In the morning we got a better response from an airbnb staff but still throughout the day was left with guessing and little to no respnse from either parties. Then I was gaslit for "locking myself out" even though the key broke and we tried getting help and access for 12 hours. 12 hours we had nowhere to sleep or go I have requested a partial refund since thats all I can do but ive spent around $1000 for ONE NIGHT IN BOOKING for an airbnb I didnt get to sleep in, a hotel room 4 hours, waiting for over 12 hours for responses. Do not use airbnb IT IS NOT WORTH UR TIME OR MONEY.

title: Air b&b
text: I will never be using air b&b again . We booked a place while visiting out of country and after it was booked and paid for the guy texted us and told us the address changed . We let it go and did it anyway. The owner of the building confronted us outside stating we were not allowed to be there and he was going to call the police . The air b&b is clearly not able to even be one and there were multiple false advertisements that occurred with the listing . Never should someone pay through an app like this and get threatened to be kicked out of what they are paying for . Or for that fact get threatened to have the cops called on them in a whole different country. Air b&b is not taking any of this as a priority or handling this seriously. We paid for a place and are getting threatened. This should be an automatic refund. This is just not acceptable . Be careful when you book through them and take note that they may not be helpful if your stranded in a situation even when you have proof it was all misrepresented.

title: Don’t book
text: Used this service for the first time and the booking was a disaster. Superhost could not provide me with the apartment that I had reserve weeks in advance. Instead superhost Matt offered me one night at another location and the rest of my 6 day stay somewhere else. I agreed due to the fact it was late and I needed a place to stay for me and my family. On the second day I asked superhost Matt if I could leave my bags since I was going to go to sightsee and he said sure, without telling me that the place was booked that night by someone else. I had message him if someone was staying and he said no. He could not answer calls and there was no other way to reach him. Eventually person who booked place tossed my luggage out of apartment. Airbnb could not get me a place and I decided to ask for full refund which I did. However finding a hotel in New York was much more expensive and they refused to cover the difference . All they could offer was a coupon for 100 dollars. I will never use this service.

title: So worth it!
text: I have used Airbnb as a host and as a guest. We started hosting first, and compared to other companies that I also used, their format is so much easier to use and helpful. Five stars for just that! Any questions I had were immediately answered and very helpful. After a while, we made a trip somewhere and got a wonderful place...exactly as described...maybe nicer. Do your homework before booking. Look at reviews, check through all the photos. I’m a restless sleeper, so I always check for what people say about the bed. I always want completely private and unshared...it’s worth the few extra bucks. We save so much money this way, and often have more amenities than a nice hotel. And if you need more than one room, a house rental is the way to go. I highly recommend AirBnB.

title: All Good, Except the Customer Service
text:
Great app - user friendly, aesthetically pleasing, intuitive and functional. 

Been a host and a guest over 300 times since 2014. My ONLY issue with Airbnb is the customer service (it was good back in 2014, only deteriorated the past couple years).

However, that one issue is so significant, that I’ve completely stopped hosting. Airbnb doesn’t protect its hosts. I had one guest repeatedly break the house rules (the rule he continued to break endangered myself & my 2 other Airbnb guests). When I asked Airbnb to ask him to leave (bear in mind, I let it go with a verbal warning the first time it happened) they refunded his money and said it was because I canceled. When I wrote back saying I didn’t cancel, he violated house rules and caused a safety issue, Airbnb’s customer service responded saying it’s not a safety issue, it’s a “personality” issue.

Well, as a host, I made rules that protected my home and the people in it. Airbnb has guests read and accept these rules prior to booking. This guest did read and accept, then he broke the rules twice. Airbnb penalized me for it. Not him. 

Airbnb’s customer service team doesn’t care. They pluck responses from a drop down menu and don’t bother to use their brains and/or any empathy.  As a guest, sure, use Airbnb. As a host - know that you’re on your own and that Airbnb will always support the guest over you, even when the guest is clearly in the wrong.

title: Horrible Customer Service
text:
You can quickly browse through the reviews and you will quickly see the trend of the unacceptable customer service level that Airbnb is providing. 

My story is no different. Recently, I booked a stay and when I arrived and entered into the house there was a girl in her night gown and we scared each other. She had no idea I was going to be there and neither did I. Unknown to me and the two girls also staying there, the homeowner was renting their place like a hostel. It was midnight when this occurred, so I just went to my room, locked the door, and tried to grab a couple hours of sleep. I left right away and messaged Airbnb through the safety section of the app. I expressed my concern of my safety and the safety of the two ladies. 

It took Airbnb 6 days to respond. I wish I could post screenshots of the conversation that is still happening with Airbnb. It’s absolutely ridiculous. Mostly, the Airbnb Rep is just talking to them selves and checking in with me to see how I’m doing and letting me know they are signing off for the night. Not once in the four days of their messages to me have they once addressed or provided any solution or acknowledgment of the safety issue I sent to them. 

I am looking and thinking hard about whether or not I will ever use Airbnb again in the future. This company has obviously gotten so big that all they care about is the money and not their users.

title: If I could give it a zero I would.
text: This app in general is glitchy and unhelpful as it is but Airbnb as a company is absolutely unprofessional and sketchy. They do not do proper background checks on the hosts or the property rules. I ended up getting scammed by a host who had 4 fake accounts that they admitted to. The room had nothing but a bare mattress on the floor with broken furniture everywhere and when I contacted the office of the condominium I rented, I was informed that they do not allow residents to sublet and/or rent out rooms for Airbnb’s. (Mind you I rented the entire condo). Airbnb decided to tell me that the FAKE SCAMMER HOST has to be the one to refund my money when AIRBNB was the company to approve a FAKE ACCOUNT. I didn’t do anything to deserve to be stolen from. And the fact that they are doing nothing to even try to help me get my money back goes to show that they will literally approve anyone to rent and not care if it’s a real or fake account. Be careful. They will let anyone post fake Airbnb’s on here. Be safe and just stay at a hotel.

title: Loved the map option to locate bnb's close to my activities.
text: I prefer a place to myself, rather than a room at a place occupied by the owner.  It was a bit difficult to discern which was which.  Impossible to tell via the location map, which I wanted to go by.  So I had to repeatedly look at both back and forth all night for hours, between the 'list' and the 'map'. It was nearly impossible to contact the owner to ask permission to check in early.  And a payment issue was not identified to myself, until I was almost there.  I had no booking.  And I had to scramble to figure out if that was true or not and re-book.  It all worked out.  But not until I borrowed a computer to better see why the issue was, since I couldn't figure it out on the app.

title: Their customer service is a total 🗑🔥
text: I had a place booked four months out (during global pandemic mind you) and the host had to cancel on me. Air B&B was so to respond and it took a couple days for them to get in touch with the host to cancel. I asked Air B&B for a little compensation towards a future booking for the inconvenience and they said that “as much as they would like to” I should have contacted them right away but because I didn’t they could not compensate me their normal 10% towards a future booking. I asked to escalate to a supervisor and the supervisor said again we would love to compensate you but we have policies against it, and completely closed my support case not allowing me to respond. Way to blame the customer on a problem out of their control and not compensate them and shut them up during a time where we should be patient and graceful with each other. Not booking a vacation rental with you ever again. Broke my trust, which apparently Air B&B would rather do than 10% towards giving them more money?!? 🗑🔥

title: Worst service/support ever i faced in my online life
text: In March of 2020, someone booked on Airbnb from my CreditCard, it was not me, i don't know who did this, maybe someone stole my CC info somewhere, i don't know. Please keep in mind that i'm software engineer with 14+years experience and things like phishing/hijacking and etc. is impossible to do with me, so someone just took a photo fo my CC or something like this. So, i'm charged from Bank and transaction is already was done, I sent message to Airbnb and guess what they did? ) - Nothing ) 3 times i sent message and each time they are answering me - Please contact your Bank. That's all - no explanation, no detailed message, no sorry, no refund. I contacted to my Bank and they sent me screenshot of transaction, it's already done, so they are unable to make chargeback process, in this case responsible is only AIRBNB but they don't care, they are sending me message once in a week and just copy paste - please contact your bank. I hate your support Airbnb and this is my last visit on your site.

title: DO NOT USE
text: I have only used this app once and the first time I experienced no issues. Customer service was great. The hosts I stayed at lied about their review for me but I made a response and thought that was the end of it. My birthday is two months away and I was going to book an airbnb for my birthday. First I was told they detected a party for no reason. I reached out to support THREE times before I got help and by then the reservation I wanted was booked for the days I wanted. I was told the issue was resolved and I booked. Everything was fine. I was charged and that was it. 12 hours later my reservation was canceled so I reached out to the hosts and they told me that airbnb cancelled it. I called and they said since I already had cases open I would have to wait for a response. I was told I’d get one by the end of the day and I didn’t receive one until 2 am where they told me basically they do not care and it was just canceled. Do yourself a favor DO NOT USE THIS APP THEY HAVE HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE

title: Not user friendly
text: Why is there not an option to select single story dwelling? Some listing show as “step free accessibility” but they’re multi story so that’s basically pointless. Obviously listers are not informed about what this is for, so something like “single story dwelling” would help dwindle down listings. It would also be nice to see a feature that allows you select total cost, not just nightly rate. I appreciate the nightly rate but when someone’s cleaning and service fee is equal to or even twice as much as a nightly stay you’re left weeding a bunch of those out too. A feature to draw an area you’re looking at, not just zoom in on the map, would be great too. The app works, but there is just a lot of room for improvement to really be user friendly. As it is now even after narrowing your search you are still left weeding out dozens of options that don’t fit what you are really looking for.

title: Silencing of my review/non-response
text: When it came to reviewing my stay in Hendersonville, NC, I did so as prompted by Airbnb.  They asked me to rate my personal experience at the property and also asked me to share relevant information which would help future travelers make best decisions for themselves.  Within hours and without notifying me, my review was removed by Airbnb. When I “noticed” that my review was no longer posted, I called Airbnb. The customer service and subsequent response from Airbnb 96 hours later was awful and unprofessional .  From hour 1 through to hour 96, I had to continually call, no one ever called me back as promised, and was placed on ‘hold’ for up to an hour each time I called. When I finally got a hold of someone again on day 5,  he had nothing constructive to share. Basically I was silenced because my review was not a 5 star rating of a “Superhost”. They don’t care or want to hear about customer experiences unless the review is A+, it’s bad for business. Never again !

title: Never using Airbnb again
text: This app will show you places for trips on dates you DID NOT ask for. It got me and my friend 2x. The second time I asked my host to cancel my reservation because 1. It was for the wrong dates & 2. I didn’t even stay at the actual Airbnb. It was early in the day so I didn’t think it was fair to have to pay for the cleaning fee and 1 nights stay. My host literally told me that they couldn’t cancel it on their end which I know is a lie because my friends host did it for her. They just wanted the free money. Of course Airbnb took their side. I called exactly 24 hrs before my reservation but my host didn’t get back to be until 23hrs beforehand. The “flexible” refund policy is worded different in the description of the properties and in the Airbnb FAQs. This was the last straw. I’m never using these scammers again. I was told I’d receive a call from customer service 2 days ago and I still haven’t gotten any word.

title: No One Upholding Standards
text: Altogether, we booked 2 trips through Air BNB. The first one was awful and not as represented in the listing, so Air BNB refunded our money and gave us a credit towards another stay which was nice. The second place which was to make up for the first reservation was infested with cockroaches which we have pictures of. We reached out to the host who said she would refund us. After 2 weeks of no resolution, she said she had reached out to Air BNB and they were going to resolve it. That was 2 weeks ago and I’ve not received any type of contact or communication from Air BNB about it. My partner and I both took off work unpaid for each of the trips we booked through Air BNB, but did not get to enjoy any of the time. I will never use Air BNB again, and will warn friends and family from booking with Air BNB as well. We have since reserved a hotel room with a jacuzzi tub for a weekend, as we know it will be relaxing and up to par and will hopefully make up for the getaway we’ve been trying to have since August.

title: Great customer service - great support during covid
text:
During this time they have provided great customer service, they were easier to reach and deal with then any other travel related company. In this time we had to deal with expedia and multiple airlines and we can only wish they are as easy and as prompt to deal with as airbnb .. all of our questions were answered very quick and we didn’t have to wait on refunds for several weeks as we did with all other companies. As a guest i can only thank you for doing such a great job. 

In past several years that we have been using airbnb to travel they have always done a great job - they helped with issues if any with hosts, site and app are easy to use .

title: Least User Friendly App EVER
text:
The app is totally janky, continuously loading random pictures while you’re trying to push buttons, so when you press a button the screen drops and takes you to a different place, and you have to start all over again.

Then there’s the booking issues. First it asked me to upload a picture of my passport, then it said that didn’t work. Then it asked to it take a picture with this device (and iPhone) and it tells me the device I have doesn’t have a camera. So it then forces me to download the app, but doesn’t remember what place I was looking at, so I have to scroll through tons of options again until I find what I want. THEN I can’t pay. USD isn’t an option, so it asks me to change it to RMB. Fine. Put all the information in again. Then it says RMB is no good. I can only pay with AliPay. Which I don’t have.

Seriously got jerked around by this app for 45 minutes and in the end couldn’t even book. Screw AirBnb, just stay at a hotel. This app is garbage.

title: Love Airbnb as a company! App & site glitchy
text:
My SO and I have found the features and data collected by the app in concert with the site frustrating. It’s not consistent nor clear where certain features are for one. And once I start entering data and want to edit it later, I find some of it dropped! So it’s really unclear if the work is saved or nor or how to save it. Some things are just easier to type out on a full keyboard (like access instructions), yet I can only access that feature on mobile. Fees are also unclear and un-guessable. If someone requests a percentage discount, the site is no help in figuring out how to translate that to a dollar value to offer, which is time consuming and frustrating. The app really should be able to do that for us, but alas... 

Love the concept of Airbnb! Even though the execution of the site is spotty.

title: Terrible Customer Support
text:
There has not been one time that I contacted customer support where I had an issue resolved. 

I’ve been hosting on Airbnb for a year and have had guests steal from me, break items in my house and leave 1 star reviews based on lies and Airbnb again and again does nothing to resolve these issues. You will be on the line waiting for someone to be useless or you’ll send an e-mail or message through the app that will take far too long for a response that is essentially them saying there is nothing they can do to resolve the issue. 

The entire app is based around the struggle to maintain a 4.8 star rating otherwise your listing gets buried. Guests have complete power in almost every situation, unless it comes to getting a refund because Airbnb doesn’t want to lose any money. Air cover is a joke. And the rating system is busted. A guest could probably murder someone in your home and leave you a one star review and Airbnb wouldn’t remove it.

title: The New software search engine full of bugs
text: ‪Does Airbnb plan to make a forward looking statement to stock holders that the next quarters sales and profit may plummet due to the rollout of this horrible new search feature? Hosts and guests are fleeing by the thousands to other platforms! ‬ The search feature is full of bugs. I’m a software developer and this would never get out of our QA department. I’m also shocked that you would deploy this much AI which has yet to prove itself enough to risk the reputation of Airbnb. The forums that Im in are full of hosts hosts and guests who are leaving to VRBO and other platforms and this software release was the final straw for them. For a large number of hosts all their bookings have ceased. These are not all wealthy investors. These people depend on Airbnb sales to live and feed their families! I was a director at NCR so I know what I’m taking about when it comes to software! It is so bad that we believe you should pull it until you have it fully operational!

title: Handicapped Child and Family Stranded
text:
I booked a trip for my family, but before booking I reached out to the host to confirm and elevator and two bedrooms on the main floor of the unit. Host confirmed and we booked. Airline tickets bought, rental car rented and we packed up our suitcases and my son’s wheelchair and headed to Utah on vacation.

We arrived to find the elevator was down, had been for 3.5 weeks, which the Host knew and confirmed. Then the host threw me into the abyss of AirBNB non-customer service.

AirBNB offered no help. Sure they suggested a few other places, all of which had stairs and were not served by an elevator or matched up to what we had rented. 

AirBNB quit responding to my request to help, I had to demand the host get us a hotel room and then I started the process to find a new place to rent. I started at 3am and finished at 930 am and finally had a place confirmed on my own through a different service. AirBNb your thoughtlessness almost ruined our trip. As parents of a special needs child, we have a lot more prep to do than just heading out. I guess you guys just done care.

AirBNB’s foreign service reps were not helpful and quite frankly I just don’t think they understood our problem.

AirBNB didn’t reach back out to help until later that evening. Gee thanks.

I am going to be contacting the ADA and a few other services because I know this is t the first time!

Shame on you AirBNB.

title: I am an AirBnB fan! They do come through if you seek help.
text: I have rented suites in Palo Alto, Entire houses on Vancouver Island and apartments in Perth Western Australia to name a few. I have loved the online experiences while in isolation in Patagonia.  The warmth of hosts is always remarkable. AirBnb has always compensated when there was a problem - and problems are very rare. I am careful, read reviews and look at photos. . I think the negative comments here are if you need immediate help. Then you may be in trouble. I would warn you to be thorough. If you need an accessible apartment don’t presume the place doesn’t need a Sherpa.  If you have a shockingly bad neighbor there is nothing that can be done immediately. If the place says “ includes breakfast” but no food is to be found - you will have to wait a few days for a response. But overall - I think AirBnB really tries and is fair.

title: Worst customer service EVER!!
text: 2nd time using this service they claimed there was a technical issue with my account. After five days of not hearing back from a supervisor they sent me an email which claimed that I have a criminal history which I don’t. They don’t obtain social security numbers so I’m not sure why I get something from them about the fair credit reporting act. Then, the very next day after my husband had to create an account for our trip which we used and got the best review a few days prior, they terminated his account for violation of policy! All he did was book a rental, gave a really good review for the host and we got the best review ever back from the host themselves. The customer service in India is the WORST! No one ever calls you back and they give some BS excuse. VRBO has been around since 1995, so there are other options around besides this awful incompetent “company”. I’d be embarrassed to work for Airbnb. Think wisely before booking or hosting. Zero stars. Look at their Facebook first and decide for yourself.

title: Worst costumer support on earth.
text: I booked a two week stay for work travels. I looked for a pet friendly location because I travel with my dog. The listing said that pets must be approved by the host. I clicked on the booking button and stated that I would be traveling with a Great Dane. The booking was confirmed afterwards and I was contacted by the host and she pointed out there was a size limit. I apologized and said no big deal I can cancel and find a new place. The host said I wouldn’t be charged if canceling within 24hrs. But to cancel and get a refund they want to give me $140 dollars back out of 1200 for a stay I can’t use. It is my fault for missing the size limit but shouldn’t the booking been denied since I put my dog in the booking for approval in the first place. I don’t know how many people can just give away over $900 and get nothing for it and call this a good app. I’ll be looking to their competitors and I suggest everyone else find a company with better customer support as well.

title: More Than Expected
text: If you want to know more about Florence than what’s on the internet or printed in the city guidebooks, Sabrina and Luciano are an excellent couple to meet. I thought my knowledge about the city was good because I used to live in Florence and had returned over the years for lengthy visits. There’s still much to learn, and Sabrina and Luciano are ideal to talk to about the city’s history, its present, and its nuances. They even shared with me the names of their favorite restaurants and the best locations to go to for astounding vistas of the city. Their enthusiasm for life in Florence is heartfelt. The icing on this cake? Their delightful selection of both store-bought and homemade small bites to keep your appetite satisfied. The experience with Sabrina and Luciano is the ideal way to begin a vacation in beautiful Florence. I highly recommend them!

title: A great travel experience.
text:
As a traveler: The airbnb app is a great tool for who want to explore the many wonderful places to stay most countries have to offer,  other than a hotel.  They also provide the ease of booking some wonderful and unique experiences available in those cities where you can be part of the culture of the area while getting to know it from the locals living in it. 

As a host: Airbnb is a wonderful platform to showcase an extra space to rent out for travelers, getting to know new people and sharing part of your city while making some extra income. Although, since Covid their customer service has gone down (only reason I didn’t give them 5 star),  most hosts have been able to still manage and found ways to provide a safe place to stay for those brave enough to still travel.

title: Cancellation policy is ridiculous!
text: The app is ok but this is about their strict cancellation policy. I have used Airbnb a few times but this is the first time I had to cancel. I am still over a month out from the 3 nights we were suppose to stay. We had some family problems that arised so we had to cancel our trip. Go into the app to cancel and it says there is a strict cancellation policy which will be over 300 dollars that they will keep. Are you serious? So I paid pretty much 2 out of the 3 nights which  we won’t stay there plus a service fee. That is ridiculous. Who gets that money for doing nothing???? Now they can open that house up to book plus have my money. Why would anyone ever make a reservation with this place months in advance. Things come up all the time! I will never use the greedy Airbnb ever again! By the way we had other places to stay booked with this trip from another company and guess what I got alot bigger refund by far more than this place. Ridiculous!

title: So many terrible hosts and houses
text:
I have 2 travels with my friend both are using Airbnb, both are terrible experience.

1. Travel to Miami, we booked a 2 bedroom house, it looks nice from outside, but the room is very small, much smaller than a motel standard. And some unknown stains inside the bed sheet, disgusting. We complained to the host, he just asked us to cancel the order and no refund. The glass door of bathroom is broken, we’re so scared to use our hands to touch it, afraid it will fall down to hurt us. 

2. Travel to Los Angeles, a separated house with 2 bedrooms. Many broken furnitures, a leg of a chairman is almost out from the wood board. A heavy fell down occurred when my friend sit on it causally. And the lock is very annoying, it always takes more than 10mins to open the door with the key gave by host; we doubted and begged her to change a correct key, she just hang off and reply nothing, no other to say noisy AC, bad network, dirt restroom etc. certainly another bad experience.

title: Beware!
text:
Booked a month in Paris and discovered bedbugs! Got a refund on the stay but Airbnb is refusing to cover more than 30% of the original listing for a new place to stay. Booking a new place in Paris is much more expensive than what they’re offering. 

Been on a chat with Airbnb for days trying to get them to help us with new accommodations and cover the cost to make the price the same as the place we booked originally.

 Not to mention all the costs associated: finding storage for our luggage while we’re out of the city for a week(was planning to leave our bags at the original Airbnb), throwing away all the food we bought because there was no place to store it at the emergency hotel we had to book, the cost of my partner being covered in itchy bug bites for a big portion of our vacation. And spending so much time trying to connect to Airbnb support and get them to make the cost even. 

Just beware and book elsewhere, if you book with Airbnb and their lax sanitation policies cause your booking to be uninhabitable they will not cover the cost and things will get very expensive for you. Why do I have to pay because Airbnb didn’t check for bedbugs?

We’re not trying to get a free place, just trying to break even for the costs associated with having to flee an infested apartment.

Extremely unhappy with Airbnb and will not be booking with them again after this trip.

title: NEEDS UPDATE
text:
In the past, I have absolutely loved the convenience and experience I’ve had booking places to stay with Airbnb. However, recently I haven’t been able to book anything at all. Airbnb’s Support team tells me they’re working on helping me but cannot due to App Errors or Glitches preventing the “screening process” and that they’re working on this, and then they send a message saying my support case has been closed and I’m unable to book. WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT! I’ve been asked to book on their website- no difference, I’ve been told I would receive a call or further assistance from someone capable- never hear back. It’s made me pretty hesitant to continue my attempts in using their services... seeing as I haven’t been able to anyways, and they aren’t even assisting in making sure I can utilize their service. 

Hopefully they work out the quirks.. or they’ll continue to lose bookings.

title: Airbnb favors the Hosts not the renters
text: With COVID and everything else going on hotels and resorts are much more reasonably priced and many times much cheaper than Airbnb. The cancellations are dictated by the Host which means they can put whatever they want including no refunds. Hotels have options where you can reserve in advanced and  pay at the hotel and even can cancel the day of the check in  if needed which is more convenient for us as the consumer  in a situation like the one I was in where I was caught in a snow storm and wasn't able to travel and though I cancelled with more then 24 hours notice I received less than 25% of what I paid back from Airbnb. The customer service can’t even be compared when going to a hotel which will always have instant support at the front desk including late check outs and they usually prefer the repeat business from happy customers as opposed to Airbnb Hosts that don’t seem to care about repeat business.

title: They stole my money.
text:
I’ve been emailing Airbnb back and forth for a month trying to get a refund on a room I got for my honeymoon with my wife. We had stayed in it for an hour then left because it was unclean. I was just told a month late we can’t get a refund because you have to say something within 24 hours but I have had to talk to four people who wouldn’t respond for a month!!! The host said he would work with us but then backed out and changed his mind! I’m out $600 now from our honeymoon for a room we didn’t even stay in and now they are claiming they can’t do anything because it’s been longer than 24 hours. How am I supposed to notify them in 24 hours if no one responds and my host lies about giving me a refund. 

 I don’t recommend this app. Their customer support has been awful and the host was extremely rude. You can find a hotel room that is nicer and cheaper than most of the places on here. Unfortunately I learned that the very hard way which now put me out a lot of money.

title: Easy to use but always has bugs
text: The app has really good UI / UX but it ALWAYS has bugs. Anything minor from a booking comes in and randomly you don’t get email confirm or more major like when you add a cohost to one property and can then see all your others....... even the ones you cohost for. That includes phone numbers and personal details of guests. I reported it 3 times nothing happened he can still se everything even after he’s been removed from that one property and has no properties on his account! What gets me is they didn’t see how it was important. Their clients data had been breached........ for that reason and until they fix it giving something that should be 5 star a 2 star for their lack of QA and any follow through on a big bug like this one. If you want me to be your QA I’ll happily accept salary until then get the people who get paid to do it to do better.

title: Clueless about Customer Service
text:
I used to like Airbnb, until an issue happened where my trip was canceled less than 24 hours before our time of departure. Their customer service team could do nothing to help me rebook. 
When I first contacted Airbnb they seemed helpful sending me links to new places. But then there was an error with their booking system and it would not process the credit from my cancelled trip. 
I spent HOURS with customer service (4+ hours on chat, nearly 3 hours on phone- mostly on hold) and all they could do was tell me someone would email me. 
My Valentine’s day dinner was canceled because I was on the phone with Airbnb from 5pm- 8pm with NO resolution. 
At this very moment, I am supposed to be on my way to a fun experience, but thanks to Airbnb’s lack of response and inability to help their customers, my vacation is wasted and I am beyond frustrated. I recommend using a more professional company, such as a normal hotel or VRBO so you can avoid the headache and heartache I went through.

title: Could be better
text: Airbnb recently made big efforts to revamp its search engines by including things like “tiny homes” and “tree houses” as searchable items. Good idea but they missed the mark. What I really care about - and I think other users may feel the same? - is what is available to you at your stay. The Vacasa app includes “kayaks”, “bikes” “tennis courts” as searchable filters. Availability of these things - along with a home gym or example a gym within a certain distance, as well as a whole host of equipment for other interests - is an important part of choosing a rental. I can - and I do - inquire about these things directly with the property owner before I choose to rent. But using Airbnb would be much easier if these were filters from the getgo. I am currently using the Vacasa app to search for a fall rental that includes kayaks on-site. Much more streamlined.

title: Fraudulent listings causing stress and danger
text:
I have traveled a variety of countries around the world, but Airbnb is at a point that I do not feel safe. 

Since May of this year, I have been to three different Airbnb‘s that were not what they were listed as. One of them had not functional Internet, which required me to buy an additional cell phone plan to work my job. I was also shocked by the electric stove there so severely that it spilled the pot and flung food on the wall. I received no compensation from staying at this place. Another Airbnb that I stayed for only a few days and nonfunctioning Internet and Airbnb partially compensated me, which was surprising, considering the one with significantly worse problems gave me no compensation, and that was a stay for a month.

A later stay involved finding a place with mildew and broken glass upon arrival.

Another stay involved a place advertised as having ocean view that had no view of the ocean. It was then up to me to find a place in a new city without a car where I don’t speak the native language well. 

Part of what used to make Airbnb convenient is that you could meet with people and see what your place looks like before staying in it. 

Since I have seen three places that were considerably different from advertised in only five months my conclusion is that Airbnb is having issues company and they are not reliable.
